alert.note: Alert for Pribilof Islands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 3:17AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS DEVELOPING WITH SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW CHANGING TO RAIN THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH TONIGHT... A strong low pressure system is poised to move along the Aleutian Chain today before entering the southern Bering Sea tonight into Wednesday. Easterly to east-northeasterly winds will pick up this morning and peak with gusts to 55 mph in the afternoon to early evening. Winds begin to weaken and turn more northeasterly during the late evening and overnight hours. The front will reach the Pribilof Islands this afternoon into the early evening hours. Precipitation will begin from south to north as the winds are peaking. There could be enough cold air in place initially that St. Paul Island could experience a period of snow and blowing snow late this afternoon into the evening hours before mixing with and changing over to rain.
